frameDefinitions: This frame contains general locale words, and is mostly a place-holder in the hierarchy.
A Producer produces a Product from a Resource for commercial purposes. '
An Agent prepares for an Activity. ''
This frame has to do with nouns denoting types of entities.
An Agent causes Air to move in a direction, usually specifying either in or out of the body.
Words in this frame have to do with a Cognizer creating a new intellectual entity, the Idea.
frameExamples: They <t>produced</t> only half of the units after an injunction to follow the environmental policy.
The troops were <t>preparing</t> themselves for the mission.
I don't like this newfangled <t><fex name='Subtype'>kind</fex></t> of  fish.
I 've been trying to <t>come up</t> with a plan .
listRoleDefinitions: A stable bounded area.  It is typically the designation of the nouns of Locale-derived frames.
The person or company that produces the Product.
The <fen>Product</fen> is produced by the <fen>Producer</fen>.
<fen>Factory</fen> identifies the particular plant where the <fen>Product</fen> is manufactured.
This Fe identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the product was produced.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the <fen>Product</fen> is manufactured.
An <fen>Agent</fen> prepares for an <fen>Activity</fen>.
This role identifies the <fen>Activity</fen> for which an <fen>Agent</fen> is preparing.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> at which an <fen>Agent</fen> prepares for an <fen>Activity</fen>.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where an <fen>Agent</fen> prepares for an <fen>Activity</fen>.
The entity which denotes a subtype of the more general <fen>Category</fen>.
The more general type that the target denotes a subtype of. This role is obligatory and should be labeled DNI when not present.
The <fen>Agent</fen>'s breathing causes the motion of the <fen>Air</fen>.  <fen>Agent</fen> is generally the External Argument.
<fen>Air</fen> is the substance that the <fen>Agent</fen> causes to move.
The time at which breathing occurs.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the breathing occurs.

Cognizer is the person who comes up with or conceptualizes the Invention. It is normally expressed as an External Argument: 

<fex name='Cognizer'>Kim</fex> <t>devised</t> a new recipe.
Invention is the intellectual creation of the Cognizer. It is normally expressed as an NP Object, but sometimes as a PP Complement:
The <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Idea</fen> is created.
The location in which the <fen>Cognizer</fen> comes up with the <fen>Idea</fen>.
listRoleExamples: There used to be a forest in that area.
Those machines were manufactured <fex>in the Miami plant</fex>.
Those leather shoes were made <fex>in Italy</fex>.
I don't like this <fex>kind</fex> of fish.
They created a new breed <fex>of dog</fex>.
All I know is that he was still breathing <fex>at 2AM</fex>.
Lee breathed with difficulty <fex>on the track</fex>.
You had better hatch some plans <fex>before you get there</fex>.
She had cooked up the story <fex>in Pisa</fex>, before she even left Italy.
